JournalEntry.title: Journal Entry
JournalEntry.description: Represents a daily journal entry for a user to track learning and tasks.

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns this journal entry.

entryDate.description: The date for the journal entry in YYYY-MM-DD format.

topicsLearned.description: A summary of topics the user learned on this day.

nextSteps.description: The user's plan for what to do next.

status.description: The status of the tasks for the day.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the entry was created.

Course.title: Course
Course.description: Represents an online course a user is tracking.

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns this course.

platform.description: The platform where the course is hosted (e.g., Udemy, Coursera).

totalModules.description: The total number of modules or lessons in the course.

modulesCompleted.description: The number of modules the user has completed.

estimatedHours.description: The estimated total hours to complete the course.

status.description: The current status of the course.

addedAt.description: The timestamp when the course was added.

QuizHistory.title: QuizHistory
QuizHistory.description: Stores the history of quizzes taken by users, including points, and answer statistics.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the user who took the quiz.

quizName.description: The name or title of the quiz.

points.description: The total points earned by the user on the quiz.

correctAnswers.description: The number of questions answered correctly.

wrongAnswers.description: The number of questions answered incorrectly.

completionDate.description: The date and time when the quiz was completed.

email.description: The email address of the user.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to store quiz history and points, as well as correct and wrong answer ratios, for users of the Prograde application. The core principle is to ensure authorization independence, allowing for secure and scalable data access. The structure implements path-based ownership for user-specific data and avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies.

The structure is as follows:

*   `/users/{userId}/quiz_history/{quizHistoryId}`: Stores the quiz history for each user. The `userId` parameter ensures that only the user can access their own quiz history. There is no need to store the `userId` again in the quiz history document because it is already present in the parent collection. Since this path implements path-based ownership, authorization independence is already achieved. This structure also supports simple `list` operations, satisfying the QAPs.
*   `/users/{userId}/courses/{courseId}`: Stores the courses for each user, ensuring data is partitioned by user for security and query efficiency.
*   `/users/{userId}/journalEntries/{entryId}`: Stores daily journal entries for each user, partitioned by user for security.
